title: Colombia is G Adventures’ ‘next big thing’
text:
Colombia is G Adventures’ ‘next big thing’ 6 August 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
﻿G Adventures has credited the introduction of nine new tours and government-backed discounts with a fivefold growth in its Colombia programme. 
Managing director Brian Young said in the first seven months of the year the operator had seen a 520% increase in passengers to the country. 
He added that much of this had been driven by the inclusion of the new tours, which represent a 475% increase in the destination’s programme. 
The figures were also boosted by a partnership with ProColombia, a government agency promoting exports, investment and tourism, which meant the operator could offer a 15% discount on trips sold in July. 
Young said: “Colombia is the next big thing in South America right now, and we’re particularly excited about the launch of the lesser-known Lost City Trekking. 
“There really is something for everyone in Colombia with our new programme. Trip options include cultural highlights, big cities, rural villages, northern indigenous culture, Caribbean landscapes and active trekking trips.” 
The Lost City Trekking seven-day tour leads in at £499 and includes full-board accommodation but does not include flights. Departures are available on a year-round basis.
